Structs/KUSMessageAction.html#/s:12Kusto.name: value
Structs/KUSMessageAction.html#/s:12Kusto.abstract: Identifier of action. Usually similar to displayText, but not always

Structs/KUSMLLNode.html#/s:12KustomerCha.name: value
Structs/KUSMLLNode.html#/s:12KustomerCha.abstract: Identifier of MLL node. Usually similar to displayText, but not always

Structs/KUSKBDeflectResult.html.name: KUSKBDeflectResult
Structs/KUSKBDeflectResult.html.abstract: A knowledge base (KB) article or category matching a KB deflection chat assistant response.

Structs/KUSMLLNode.html.name: KUSMLLNode
Structs/KUSMLLNode.html.abstract: A node in a multi-level list associated with a chat message. Chat messages using the MLL template type can be responded to by selecting one of their child nodes.

Structs/KUSMessageAction.html.name: KUSMessageAction
Structs/KUSMessageAction.html.abstract: An action you can use to reply to a KUSChatMessage that has a quick reply message template

Structs/KUSClamping.html.name: KUSClamping
Structs/KUSClamping.html.abstract: Use @KUSClamping to guarantee that a property modeling acidity in a chemical solution within the conventional range of 0 – 14.

Protocols/KUSConnectionListener.html#/s:.name: onPubNubConnectionStatusChange(status:)
Protocols/KUSConnectionListener.html#/s:.abstract: Directly observe the PubNub connection status for the main pubnub connection

Protocols/KUSChatListener.html#/s:12Kust.name: onChatMessageReceived(conversationId:chatMessage:)
Protocols/KUSChatListener.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: When a new chat message is received. Order not guaranteed. In your UI, sort by createdAt to recover the correct message order.

Protocols/KUSChatListener.html#/s:12Kust.name: onConversationCreated(conversationId:conversation:)
Protocols/KUSChatListener.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: When a new conversation is created and successfully sent to the Kustomer servers

Protocols/KUSURLConvertible.html#/s:12Ku.name: kus_asURL()
Protocols/KUSURLConvertible.html#/s:12Ku.abstract: Returns a URL from the conforming instance or throws.

Protocols/KUSURLConvertible.html.name: KUSURLConvertible
Protocols/KUSURLConvertible.html.abstract: Types adopting the URLConvertible protocol can be used to construct URLs, which can then be used to construct

Protocols/KUSChatListener.html.name: KUSChatListener
Protocols/KUSChatListener.html.abstract: Subscribe to this to receive chat events. See https://kustomer.readme.io/docs/building-your-own-ui#a-suggested-pattern—iosswift for a guide to how to use KUSChatListener.

Protocols/KUSConnectionListener.html.name: KUSConnectionListener
Protocols/KUSConnectionListener.html.abstract: Lets you observe when you’re disconnected. Core SDK only - if you’re using our UI you do not need to use this.

Extensions/URLComponents.html#/s:10Found.name: kus_asURL()
Extensions/URLComponents.html#/s:10Found.abstract: Returns a URL if the self‘s url is not nil, otherwise throws.

Extensions/String.html#/s:SS12KustomerCh.name: kus_asURL()
Extensions/String.html#/s:SS12KustomerCh.abstract: Returns a URL if self can be used to initialize a URL instance, otherwise throws.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: default
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Shows the default chat experience selected under Channels > Chat > Design> Chat Widget Experience.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: chatHistory
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Show chat history. If KB is enabled under Channels > Chat > Design> Chat Widget Experience, the KB tab will be visible.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: newChat
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Shows a new chat. If KB is enabled under Channels > Chat > Design> Chat Widget Experience, the KB tab will be visible.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: activeChat
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Show the most recent active chat. If KB is enabled under Channels > Chat > Design> Chat Widget Experience, the KB tab will be visible.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: knowledgeBase
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Show the knowledge base. If live chat is enabled under Channels > Chat > Design> Chat Widget Experience, the chat tab will be visible.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: onlyChat
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Show live chat. Always hides the Knowledge Base tab.

Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.name: onlyKnowledgeBase
Enums/KustomerDisplayMode.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: Show the knowledge base. Always hides the chat tab.

Enums/KustomerUI/Color.html#/s:12Kustome.name: color(_:)
Enums/KustomerUI/Color.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: load the color .colorset from the calling app’s bundle, then the SDK bundle

Enums/KustomerUI/Color.html.name: Color
Enums/KustomerUI/Color.html.abstract: Colors used by the Kustomer UI. Customizable. See https://kustomer.readme.io/docs/custom-colors

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: named(_:)
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: A custom error, with a meaningful localizedDescription parameter

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: generic(_:)
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: a standard error from a system or other library, wrapped in KError. Examine the nested error parameter to find the description.

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: alamofire(_:)
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: an Alamofire error. Examine the nested error parameter to find the description.

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: api(details:)
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: an error from our rest api. the details parameter contains the full json error object from the rest api.

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: describeCurrentCustomerIsAnonymous
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: You can only describe a non-anonymous customer. A customer becomes non-anon in 2 ways: having at least one conversation, or having an externalId/email assigned to them by calling .identify

Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.name: errorDescription
Enums/KError.html#/s:12KustomerChat6KErr.abstract: A description of a KError, similar to a localizedDescription on an Error

Enums/KUSConversationStatus.html#/s:12Ku.name: ended
Enums/KUSConversationStatus.html#/s:12Ku.abstract: The user or the customer has ended the conversation

Enums/KUSConversationStatus.html#/s:12Ku.name: new
Enums/KUSConversationStatus.html#/s:12Ku.abstract: The conversation hasn’t been sent to the Kustomer servers yet

Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html#/s:.name: user_ended
Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html#/s:.abstract: The agent, a workflow, a chat assistant, or other system process ended the conversation

Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html#/s:12.name: offline
Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html#/s:12.abstract: Appear offline when outside of business hours

Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html#/s:12.name: online
Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html#/s:12.abstract: Appear online when outside of business hours

Enums/KustomerLogType.html#/s:12Kustomer.name: fatal
Enums/KustomerLogType.html#/s:12Kustomer.abstract: To log something that will break the SDK instead of allowing a crash

Enums/KustomerLogType.html#/s:12Kustomer.name: multithreadingWarning
Enums/KustomerLogType.html#/s:12Kustomer.abstract: To log potential misuse of multithreading or Core Data contexts

Enums/KustomerConnectionStatus.html#/s:1.name: connected
Enums/KustomerConnectionStatus.html#/s:1.abstract: Is online, or offline but will auto-reconnect on its own and reply any missed events.

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: uninitialized
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: have not set the api key or options

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: configured
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: have set the api key and options

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: configurationError(error:)
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: .configure() failed. you can’t use the SDK in this state

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: starting
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: is getting settings, biz schedules, and/or a tracking token

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: started
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: have settings, schedules, and a tracking token

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: stopped
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: do not have settings, schedules, and a tracking token. happens before you call .start(), or if .start() errors out

Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: disconnected
Enums/KustomerClientStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: is .started, but is not connected to pubsub

Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: success
Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: sent message, was successfully received and processed by Kustomer’s platform

Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: error
Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: error sending the message. you should retry. the message was not received by Kustomer’s platform.

Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.name: cancelled
Enums/KUSChatMessageStatus.html#/s:12Kus.abstract: you cancelled sending this message. similar to KUSChatMessageStatus.error, except that cancelled is for when the user was the one to cancel, not a problem w/ transmission

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSURLRequestValidation.name: bodyDataInGETRequest(_:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSURLRequestValidation.abstract: URLRequest with GET method had body data.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: KUSOutput
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: The output of a server trust evaluation.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: noRequiredEvaluator(host:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: No ServerTrustEvaluator was found for the associated host.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: noCertificatesFound
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: No certificates were found with which to perform the trust evaluation.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: noPublicKeysFound
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: No public keys were found with which to perform the trust evaluation.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: policyApplicationFailed(trust:policy:status:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: During evaluation, application of the associated SecPolicy failed.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: settingAnchorCertificatesFailed(status:certificates:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: During evaluation, setting the associated anchor certificates failed.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: revocationPolicyCreationFailed
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: During evaluation, creation of the revocation policy failed.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: trustEvaluationFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: SecTrust evaluation failed with the associated Error, if one was produced.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: revocationCheckFailed(output:options:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: Revocation check failed with the associated Output and options.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: customEvaluationFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: Custom server trust evaluation failed due to the associated Error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: inputDataNilOrZeroLength
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: The server response contained no data or the data was zero length.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: inputFileNil
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: The file containing the server response did not exist.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: inputFileReadFailed(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: The file containing the server response could not be read from the associated URL.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: jsonSerializationFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: JSON serialization failed with an underlying system error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: decodingFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: A DataDecoder failed to decode the response due to the associated Error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: customSerializationFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: A custom response serializer failed due to the associated Error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: invalidEmptyResponse(type:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: Generic serialization failed for an empty response that wasn’t type Empty but instead the associated type.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: dataFileNil
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: The data file containing the server response did not exist.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: dataFileReadFailed(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: The data file containing the server response at the associated URL could not be read.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: missingContentType(acceptableContentTypes:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: The response did not contain a Content-Type and the acceptableContentTypes provided did not contain a

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: unacceptableContentType(acceptableContentTypes:responseContentType:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: The response Content-Type did not match any type in the provided acceptableContentTypes.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: unacceptableStatusCode(code:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: The response status code was not acceptable.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.name: customValidationFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseValidationFa.abstract: Custom response validation failed due to the associated Error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.name: url
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.abstract: The URL was missing or unable to be extracted from the passed URLRequest or during encoding.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.name: httpMethod(rawValue:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.abstract: The HTTPMethod could not be extracted from the passed URLRequest.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.name: encoderFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncoderFail.abstract: The underlying encoder failed with the associated error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.name: missingURL
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.abstract: The URLRequest did not have a URL to encode.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.name: jsonEncodingFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.abstract: JSON serialization failed with an underlying system error during the encoding process.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.name: customEncodingFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSParameterEncodingFai.abstract: Custom parameter encoding failed due to the associated Error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartURLInvalid(url:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The fileURL provided for reading an encodable body part isn’t a file URL.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFilenameInvalid(in:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The filename of the fileURL provided has either an empty lastPathComponent or `pathExtension.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFileNotReachable(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The file at the fileURL provided was not reachable.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFileNotReachableWithError(atURL:error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: Attempting to check the reachability of the fileURL provided threw an error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFileIsDirectory(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The file at the fileURL provided is actually a directory.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFileSizeNotAvailable(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The size of the file at the fileURL provided was not returned by the system.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartFileSizeQueryFailedWithError(forURL:error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The attempt to find the size of the file at the fileURL provided threw an error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: bodyPartInputStreamCreationFailed(for:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: An InputStream could not be created for the provided fileURL.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: outputStreamCreationFailed(for:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: An OutputStream could not be created when attempting to write the encoded data to disk.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: outputStreamFileAlreadyExists(at:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The encoded body data could not be written to disk because a file already exists at the provided fileURL.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: outputStreamURLInvalid(url:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The fileURL provided for writing the encoded body data to disk is not a file URL.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: outputStreamWriteFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The attempt to write the encoded body data to disk failed with an underlying error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.name: inputStreamReadFailed(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSMultipartEncodingFai.abstract: The attempt to read an encoded body part InputStream failed with underlying system error.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.name: KUSResponseSerializationFailureReason
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSResponseSerializatio.abstract: The underlying reason the response serialization error occurred.

Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.name: KUSServerTrustFailureReason
Enums/KUSAFError/KUSServerTrustFailureRe.abstract: Underlying reason a server trust evaluation error occurred.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: downloadedFileMoveFailed(error:source:destination:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: SessionDelegate threw an error while attempting to move downloaded file to destination URL.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: invalidURL(url:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: URLConvertible type failed to create a valid URL.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: parameterEncodingFailed(reason:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: ParameterEncoding threw an error during the encoding process.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: parameterEncoderFailed(reason:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: ParameterEncoder threw an error while running the encoder.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: requestRetryFailed(retryError:originalError:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: RequestRetrier threw an error during the request retry process.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: serverTrustEvaluationFailed(reason:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: ServerTrustEvaluating instance threw an error during trust evaluation.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: sessionDeinitialized
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: Session which issued the Request was deinitialized, most likely because its reference went out of scope.

Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.name: sessionInvalidated(error:)
Enums/KUSAFError.html#/s:12KustomerChat1.abstract: Session was explicitly invalidated, possibly with the Error produced by the underlying URLSession.

Enums/KUSAFError.html.name: KUSAFError
Enums/KUSAFError.html.abstract: AFError is the error type returned by Alamofire. It encompasses a few different types of errors, each with

Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html.name: KustomerOffhoursDisplay
Enums/KustomerOffhoursDisplay.html.abstract: How to handle chat when outside of business hours

Enums/KUSChatMessageDirection.html.name: KUSChatMessageDirection
Enums/KUSChatMessageDirection.html.abstract: Is the message inbound (sent from the customer) or outbound (sent to the customer)

Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html.name: KUSConversationLockReason
Enums/KUSConversationLockReason.html.abstract: Reason for the conversation being locked (closed, locked, and ended are all the same).

Enums/KUSSentByType.html.name: KUSSentByType
Enums/KUSSentByType.html.abstract: Type of entity that sent or composed the message

Enums/KUSMessageTemplateType.html.name: KUSMessageTemplateType
Enums/KUSMessageTemplateType.html.abstract: Every chat message has a template. Plain text and markdown messages use ‘text’.

Enums/KError.html.name: KError
Enums/KError.html.abstract: Errors from the KustomerChat. See the error’s localizedDescription property for a description the error.

Enums/KustomerAssetLanguage.html.name: KustomerAssetLanguage
Enums/KustomerAssetLanguage.html.abstract: An enum listing all the asset translations supported out of the box.

Enums/KustomerLanguage.html.name: KustomerLanguage
Enums/KustomerLanguage.html.abstract: Language used to render the Kustomer UI (all except KB).

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: teamName
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: The name of the support team to be displayed

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: teamIconUrl
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: The URL where the team icon image can be found

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: widgetType
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Whether to show chat, kb, or both

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: greeting
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: The greeting displayed when the organization is available

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: offhoursDisplay
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: How to handle chat when outside of business hours. Either act like the organization is online, show it as offline, or hide chat entirely.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: offhoursMessage
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Greeting message to show at top of screen when offline (outside of business hours). Shown when outside of business hours (or during a holiday) and when offhoursDisplay == .offline

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: offhoursImageUrl
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Image to display when offline (outside of business hours) on the blank new conversation screen.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: waitMessage
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Message to show before an agent joins the conversation, at the top of the chat screen. Shown when inside of business hours and not during a holiday. If offlineDisplay == .online, this is also shown outside of business hours/holidays.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: activeAssistant
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Chat assistant to use for all new conversations

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: enabled
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: If false, completely disables Kustomer. To edit, go to Channels > Chat > Settings > Enable Chat toggle on the Kustomer website.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: singleSessionChat
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: If true, customer can’t create a new chat if they already have one open

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: noHistory
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: when chats are “ended” they should vanish. vanish = not in history, not in unread count, none of their messages viewable

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: showTypingIndicatorWeb
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: If we should send typing indicators when the customer is typing on their phone.

Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.name: showTypingIndicatorCustomerWeb
Classes/Settings.html#/s:12KustomerChat8.abstract: Show if the agent is typing in the mobile sdk.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: enableUI
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Enables the Kustomer UI. Defaults to true. If you want to use any of the Kustomer UI this must be true. To build your own UI, set to false.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: language
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: The language to show volume control, automated messages, snippets, and KB for. If blank, uses the device’s language.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: debugMode
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Enable debug mode. Adds several menus that you can show by shaking the phone.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: activeAssistant
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: If supplied, always uses this chat assistant ID when pressing new conversation button in the UI. No effect on the core sdk.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: disablePush
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Do not use push notifications. Push is automatically turned on when you configure push on the Kustomer website. Use this flag to disable.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: businessScheduleId
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: The business schedule ID you want the app to use. Optional.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: knowledgeBaseID
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: The brand ID for the Knowledge Base you’d like to present. Optional.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: logLevels
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: An array of KustomerLogTypes you want to have printed to the console. Defaults to all KustomerLogTypes: [.debug, .info, .error, .warning]. KustomerLogType.fatal errors are always logged.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.name: messageAttachmentLocalCacheMaximumSizeInBytes
Classes/KustomerOptions.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Max size of local cache for message attachments. Defaults to 25MB. Minimum of 10MB, maximum of Int.max.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: chatProvider
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: This provider class is used to interact with all chat related functionality. See ChatProvider

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: pushProvider
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: This provider is used to interact with push notification related functions. See PushProvider

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: shared
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Shared, thread-safe, singleton

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: status
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: The status of the KustomerClient

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: bundle
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Bundle containing SDK resources

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: sdkVersion
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Version of the Kustomer SDK

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: pushKeysPresentAndPushEnabled
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: getSdkVersion(file:line:function:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Version of the Kustomer SDK

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: sdkVersionBuild
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: changeActiveAssistant(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Change the ID of the chat assistant used when the user clicks ‘New conversation’.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: getActiveAssistantID()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Gets the id of the chat assistant that will be used for new conversations created by the UI. Based on the server side settings, and any runtime uses of KustomerClient.changeActiveAssistant(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: options
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: The options used to configure the SDK. KustomerOptions for Kustomer. Once passed to configure, they can’t be changed.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: orgId
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: The organization ID. Derived from your api key.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: orgName
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Your organization’s name

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: keychain
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: A separate iOS keychain for the kustomer sdk inside your app.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: useCombinedInterface
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: configure(apiKey:options:launchOptions:file:function:line:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Configures the Kustomer SDK.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: isChatAvailable(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: is it during business hours, incl. holidays? honors ‘show as available when outside business hours’

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: show()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Shows the Support Center in the default view

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: show(preferredView:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Shows the Support Center using a preferred view. See KustomerDisplayMode.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: openConversation(id:completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Opens an existing conversation

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: openChatAssistant(id:completion:afterFirstMessage:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Starts a new chat with our bot using the passed chat assistant ID.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: showKbArticle(id:completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Loads the knowledge base at a specific article

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: logOut(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Clears the user’s access to any existing chats from the device. If you’re using push, deregisters them from the Kustomer push service.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: logIn(jwt:_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Signs out the current customer if there is one. Then logs in as the customer w/ the JWT passed. Loads all their chat histories in the background, as network conditions permit.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: identifyCurrentCustomer(jwt:_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Securely identify a customer. If there are chats already started, links them to this customer. If the customer has any chat history from other devices, loads that history onto this device.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: openNewChat(initialMessages:afterCreateConversation:animated:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Creates a new conversation.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotifications(error:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: If you’re using our push notifications, place this in your AppDelegate’s application(_ application: UIApplication, didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError error: Error) method

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: didRegisterForRemoteNotifications(deviceToken:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: If you are using push notifications in the KustomerChat call this function in your own AppDelegate, passing the parameters from func application(_ application: UIApplication, didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken deviceToken: Data)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: deregisterCurrentDeviceForPushNotifications(_:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Alias for PushProvider.deregisterCurrentDeviceForPushNotifications(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: requestAuthorizationForPush()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Alias for PushProvider.requestAuthorizationForPush(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: reconnect()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Use to reconnect manually.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: stop()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Disconnects from pubsub, stops receiving all events.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: start(completion:failure:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Creates the connection to the Kustomer SDK backend.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: start()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with no callbacks. Use if you don’t care if the client starts or not. The client will auto start whenever the UI is shown, if you’re using the UI.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: start(completion:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with only a completion callback

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: start(failure:)
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Alias for KustomerClient.start(...) with only a failure callback

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: unUserNotificationCenterDelegate
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: To process push notifications that don’t come from Kustomer, set this to your own UNUserNotificationCenterDelegate. Your delegate will not receive any pushes from Kustomer.

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: getUnreadCount()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Immediately returns the current customer’s unread count. Use a KUSChatListener to be notified when this changes:

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: openConversationCount()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: See ChatProvider.openConversationCount(...)

Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.name: removeAllSessionsAndRelatedData()
Classes/KustomerClient.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: Removes all conversations and messages. Keeps the customer logged in. Keeps the SDK connected to pubsub and our platform.

Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: deviceToken
Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: The current device token. May or may not be registered for push notifications.

Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotifications(error:)
Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: If you’re using our push notifications, place this in your AppDelegate’s application(_ application: UIApplication, didFailToRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithError error: Error) method

Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: didRegisterForRemoteNotifications(deviceToken:)
Classes/PushProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: If you’re using our push notifications, place this in your AppDelegate’s func application(_ application: UIApplication, didRegisterForRemoteNotificationsWithDeviceToken deviceToken: Data)

Classes/PushProvider.html#/c:@M@Kustomer.name: userNotificationCenter(_:didReceive:withCompletionHandler:)
Classes/PushProvider.html#/c:@M@Kustomer.abstract: this gets called when you tap a push notification. if you have set a unUserNotificationCenterDelegate, your unUserNotificationCenterDelegate will get called if the notification isn’t from Kustomer.

Classes/PushProvider.html#/c:@M@Kustomer.name: userNotificationCenter(_:willPresent:withCompletionHandler:)
Classes/PushProvider.html#/c:@M@Kustomer.abstract: this gets called when you get a push notification while the app is open. if you have set a unUserNotificationCenterDelegate, your unUserNotificationCenterDelegate will get called if the notification isn’t from Kustomer.

Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.name: getArticlesAndCategories(parentCategoryId:searchText:completion:)
Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.abstract: Searches for articles and categories with the parent category id passed. If the parent category id is nil, searches for articles and categories belonging to the root category. To filter by a search string, pass a searchText parameter.

Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.name: lastUpdateAt
Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.abstract: last time the local kb data store was completely refreshed

Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.name: hasNeverUpdated
Classes/KBProvider.html#/s:12KustomerCha.abstract: if true, the kb data store is empty and you’ve never asked the server for the data

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: shared
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: listeners
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: All currently registered KUSChatListeners

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: addChatListener(_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Register a KusChatListener to the Core SDK to receive chat events

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: removeChatListener(_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Unregister a KUSChatListener using its unique String identifier

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: removeAllChatListeners()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Removes all registered KUSChatListeners from the Core SDK

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: listenForTyping(conversationId:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Begins listening for typing events.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: stopListeningForTyping(conversationId:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Stops listening for typing events.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: getConversations()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: All conversations for the current customer.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: getConversation(conversationId:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Returns a KUSConversation object for the given id. Returns nil if the ID is not found.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: chatMessages(conversationId:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Immediately returns last known list of messages for a conversation. Use a KUSChatListener to be notified when new messages come in.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: unreadCount()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Immediately returns the current customer’s unread count. Use a KUSChatListener to be notified when this changes.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: openConversationCount()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Undocumented

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: currentCustomer()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Information about the currently logged in customer

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: getChatSettings()
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Returns chat settings. Does not attempt to load or update them from the REST API

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: isChatAvailable(_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Check the “turned on/off” status of your chat alongwith within Business Hours and outside of Holidays settings asynchronously. For example if chat is turned off or outside of business hours, you may want to disable the button or deflect customers to contact an email).

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: createConversation(title:assistant:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Creates a conversation with a message.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(text:conversationId:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Sends a text message to an existing conversation.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(action:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Reply to a message from a chat assistant using an action (action == a quick reply button)

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(text:assistant:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Sends a text message as a reply to a chat assistant question.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(mllNode:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Reply to a message from a chat assistant using an MLL node

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(image:conversationId:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Posts a message containing an image to a conversation.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: sendChatMessage(fileUrl:conversationId:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Posts a message containing an file or video to a conversation.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: createAssistant(id:after:error:afterCreateConversation:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Creates a new KUSAssistant. Fetches the properties needed to use this assistant. Gets a list of initialMessages that are the same format as [KUSChatMessage]. A conversation (KUSConversation) on our system (that shows up on the Kustomer website) is not created. A KUSConversation is only created after you submit a message using this assistant.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: endConversation(conversationId:completion:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Ends an existing conversation.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: reloadChatSettings(_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Reloads chat settings and business schedules from our REST API. If the network call fails, returns an error.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: describeConversation(conversationId:attributes:_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Attach custom attributes to the user’s most recent conversation (or the first one they create)

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: describeCurrentCustomer(phone:email:phones:emails:facebook:instagram:twitter:linkedIn:custom:_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Attach custom attributes to the user

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: markRead(conversationId:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Marks a conversation as read as of right now. Any message received for this conversation after this will be treated as unread, until marked read again. This function should be called, whenever the user closes the chat view for a conversation.

Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.name: identify(jwt:_:)
Classes/ChatProvider.html#/s:12KustomerC.abstract: Securely identify a customer. Requires a valid JSON Web Token.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:12KustomerCh.name: currentId
Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:12KustomerCh.abstract: the customer id of the currently logged in customer. if you don’t use identify, this is automatically created for you.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:12KustomerCh.name: id
Classes/KUSCustomer.html#/s:12KustomerCh.abstract: the unique ID of this customer. Used by the entire Kustomer platform.

Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.name: lockedByCustomer
Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Was this conversation closed by the customer?

Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.name: respondingUserIds
Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: IDs of KUSUsers who have responded to this conversation.

Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.name: customers
Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: KUSCustomerss who have sent at least one message in this conversation.

Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.name: users
Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: KUSUsers who have sent at least one message in this conversation.

Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.name: localUuid
Classes/KUSConversation.html#/s:12Kustom.abstract: Temporary local ID. A unique identifier for conversations that have been created on-device, but not successfully sent to Kustomer’s servers and processed by the Kustomer platform.

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.name: sentById
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: ID of entity that composed this message

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.name: actions
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: For messages with associated quick reply buttons. To reply to this message, pass one of these actions to ChatProvider.shared.sendChatMessage(action:, completion:)

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.name: mllNode
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: For messages with associated quick reply buttons. To reply to this message, pass one of these actions to ChatProvider.shared.sendChatMessage(mllNode:, completion:)

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.name: deflectResults
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html#/s:12Kustome.abstract: For messages generated by KB deflect chat assistant responses. Contains matched articles.

Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html#/s:12Kust.name: url
Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html#/s:12Kust.abstract: URL used to download the attached file

Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html.name: KUSChatAttachment
Classes/KUSChatAttachment.html.abstract: A file, image, or video attachment sent with a KUSChatMessage. Belongs to a single KUSConversation and KUSChatMessage.

Classes/KUSChatMessage.html.name: KUSChatMessage
Classes/KUSChatMessage.html.abstract: A message in a conversation. Belongs to a single KUSConversation.

Classes/KUSChatSettings.html.name: KUSChatSettings
Classes/KUSChatSettings.html.abstract: A value object representing the settings of the kustomer sdk that can be set from our website.

Classes/KUSConversation.html.name: KUSConversation
Classes/KUSConversation.html.abstract: A conversation between a KUSCustomer and zero or more KUSUsers.

Classes/KUSCustomer.html.name: KUSCustomer
Classes/KUSCustomer.html.abstract: A customer is a person who uses your app. A customer receives customer support messags from one or more KUSUsers.

Classes/KUSUser.html.name: KUSUser
Classes/KUSUser.html.abstract: A user is a customer service agent or bot that sends messages to one of your customers (KUSCustomer)

Classes/PushProvider.html.name: PushProvider
Classes/PushProvider.html.abstract: Used to register/unregister devices with our push notification service. To enable push, use the Kustomer website.

Classes/KustomerClient.html.name: KustomerClient
Classes/KustomerClient.html.abstract: A singleton. This is how you interact with the Kustomer SDK.

Classes/KustomerOptions.html.name: KustomerOptions
Classes/KustomerOptions.html.abstract: Initialization options. Pass them to KustomerClient.configure(...) override any settings within the sdk.

Classes/Settings.html.name: Settings
Classes/Settings.html.abstract: Settings for your org. Fetched from the REST API. Change them on the Kustomer website, and restart your app to see the new ones. They are saved locally so you can use parts of the Kustomer SDK while offline (assuming you’ve configured and opened the Kustomer UI (regular SDK) or configured and called start(...) once (build your own UI SDK) at least once with an active internet connection).

Classes/KUSKeychain.html.name: KUSKeychain
Classes/KUSKeychain.html.abstract: A separate iOS keychain for the kustomer sdk inside your app.

Global%20Variables.html.name: Global Variables
Global%20Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.

Typealiases.html.name: Type Aliases
Typealiases.html.abstract: The following type aliases are available globally.
